com.dhemery.core

Class NullSafeUnaryOperator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dhemery.core.Named
      • com.dhemery.core.NullSafeUnaryOperator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of operand
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    UnaryOperator<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultingTo, Requiring, Trimmed, WithoutPrefix, WithoutSuffix, WithPrefix, WithSuffix

    public abstract class NullSafeUnaryOperator<T>
extends Named
implements UnaryOperator<T>
    An operator that allows subclasses to operate on the operand without checking for null.

    This implementation returns its operand, whether null or non-null. To change this behavior, override operateOnNonNull(Object), operateOnNull(), or both.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NullSafeUnaryOperator()
      Create a nameless null-safe operator.
      NullSafeUnaryOperator(String name)
      Create a null-safe operator with a fixed name.

    • Method Detail

      • operate

        public final T operate(T operand)
        Specified by:
        operate in interface UnaryOperator<T>

      • operateOnNonNull

        protected T operateOnNonNull(T operand)
        Operate on the operand, which is guaranteed not to be null.

        This implementation returns its operand. Override this method to operate on the non-null operand.

        Parameters:
        operand - the non-null operand to operate on
        Returns:
        the result of applying the operator to the operand

      • operateOnNull

        protected T operateOnNull()
        Return the operator's value for a null operand.

        This implementation returns null. Override this method to provide a value for a null operand.

        Returns:
        the result that the operator would produce for a null operand
